fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you upload files to Confluence, you can display them on the page as either a thumbnail or a link.

h3. Environment

* New confluence Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload a file
# Click on the attachment

h3. Expected Results

You will see an option to show as link
 !Screenshot 2019-04-10 at 5.46.35 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The attachment is highlighted only.


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Show as link option missing on Attachment

fields.description:
{panel:title= Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Summary

User name search of macros fails for some accounts having multibyte characters.
h3. Environment

Affected macros:
 * Task Report
 * Profile Picture

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Note that not all the multibyte characters are affected, and affected characters are not identified.
 # Try auto-complete to the affected account
 # The affected account are not listed in the candidate

h3. Expected Results

User name search works for any account names.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence complains a specific error of Elasticsearch on the server side.
h3. Notes

Mentions work properly for the affected names.
h3. Workaround

Temporarily change the display name of the affected account. The change is available at:


* https://admin.atlassian.com/ for organization admin if [a domain part of the email address is verified|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html].
* otherwise, https://id.atlassian.com/ for the affected user

 
To know if you are affected, contact Atlassian Support and provide the reproducible user name so that they can identify whether the name is affected by this case. Besides, consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: User name consisting of multibyte characters cannot be found in some macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
[Get watches for page|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-notification-child-created-get] REST API fails when testing the GDPR changes by setting {{privacyMode}} to {{true}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add more than one watcher
# Call {{/rest/api/content/\{id\}/notification/child-created?privacyMode=true}}, note the query parameter set to true

h3. Expected Results
The watchers information are returned

h3. Actual Results
{code}
{
    "statusCode": 500,
    "message": "java.lang.NullPointerException: null"
}
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Get watches for page REST API breaks if GDPR privacyMode parameter is set to true

fields.description:
It would be fairly easy to make available the recursive data from the columns that get generated for the Change History Macro.

Example:

The column for version number current could be placed in the title of the doc.
fields.summary: Grant recursive retrieval for Change History Macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  
Currently, Confluence mobile experience doesn't provide an offline experience, such as the one offered by other similar products.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create an offline experience on the Confluence mobile apps.

h3. Workaround
No workaround besides individually exporting the desired documents.
fields.summary: Offline experience on mobile

fields.description:
h3. The Suggestion
Currently, in order to get the results of Jira Issues on the Jira Issues Macro, the user needs to have access to the project in question. 

It would be nice to have a way to display the results of those issues in the Jira Issues Macro, for users who don't have access to Jira, or the issues in General, for a read-only context.
fields.summary: Allow a read-only version of Jira Issues Macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the editor available on the mobile experience (either through the apps or the mobile browser) is much limited if compared to the WYSIWYG editor available on the desktop version.

h3. Suggested Solution
Bring the new WYSIWYG editor to mobile.

h3. Workaround
No other workaround besides using the desktop version of Confluence.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG editor on mobile

fields.description:
The *language* should be changed for the *Overview Page* whenever there is a change in *indexing language*.

By default, if not customized then it will have *English* text. Although, you can have a below workaround:

The template can be edited through the *Global Template section* from Confluence Admin portal.

Follow the below steps to edit them:
 # Navigate to System templates
 # Edit the Default Personal Space Content

You can then change the template content from English to the desired language. However, it's not always feasible hence it's good to have the same default text in the language.
fields.summary: Flexibility to generate overview template page as per the indexing language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to see task-report macro on a mobile browser, tested on IOS and Android.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a page that task report macro, using a mobile browser, not the app

h3. Expected Results
See the page properly

h3. Actual Results
The message below:
 !task-report.jpeg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Use the Confluence app
fields.summary: Unable to see Task-report macro on a mobile browser

fields.description:
Alow attachments to be segregated by "Atachments" macros where users could upload different files to different "Atachments" macros on the same page, and each macro would only report the files that were uploaded directly to them.

Current Scenario
* Every "Atachments" macro will report the same files uploaded on a page (as this macro reports the attachments present on a given page).

Desired Scenario
* Each "Atachments" macro would report only the attachments that were uploaded directly to them, keeping files segregated by each macro, instead of reporting all files attached to the page.
fields.summary: "Atachments" macros should segregate files, allowing macros to display different files on the same page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Existing "Agile Wallboard Gadget" Macro is statically displayed on page and Jira issues are not movable between columns.

h3. Suggestion
Have the issues dynamically movable within the columns like "Trello Board" Macro
fields.summary: Dynamic Jira Kanban Board Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When unrestricting a page from Page Restrictions in Space settings users are redirected to a misleading page displaying "you don't have permission to view this page". The page actually gets unrestricted.

h3. Expected behaviour
* Reload current page and remove restricted page

h3. Current behaviour
* Confluence redirects to "You don't have permission to view this page"

h3. Workaround
* Ignore permission denied page and go back to Page Restriction settings
fields.summary: Unrestricting a page redirects to "Permission denied" page.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Inserting a second "Issues Statistics" macro onto any page that already contains a "Issues Statistics" macro will result in the second macro displaying fewer results than the original macro did. This can be seen in the next screenshot and video.
h3. Environment
 * "Issues Statistics" macro
 * New Confluence Editor
 * Either inserting this macro via: copying or by regular insertion ('/ ' shortcut; *+* drop-down menu) seems to trigger this BUG

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert into a page an "Issues Statistics" macro and configure it to show some issues;
 # Copy the macro and paste into the same page;
 (This is the easiest way to reproduce is to copy and paste this macro onto the same page as the original macro - it can also be achieved by inserting two identical "Issues Statistics" macro )

h3. Expected Results
 * Second Macro to display the same results as the first one;

h3. Actual Results
 # Second Macro will display significantly fewer results, as can be seen in the video and screenshots.

Video: *[^Issues Statistics.mov]*

Screenshot
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-08 at 15.25.23.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * This only seems to happen after there's already an "Issues Statistics" macro present on the page;
 * If pasted above the original macro, it will seem that the macro will work as expected, but once the page is published only the first "Issues Statistics" macro will correctly display its results;
 * Another behavior that that this BUG may present is a HUGE blank space after the reported issues. (as can be seen in this next screenshot)

!Screen Shot 2019-11-14 at 16.34.08.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pasting an "Issues Statistics" macro into a page that already contains this macro will result in different results on the pasted macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the new editor, if we try to add a Page Properties macro within an Expand macro, it will not work.

h3. Environment
 * Cloud
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page using the new editor;
# Add a Expand macro;
# In the expand macro, add a Page Properties macro.

h3. Expected Results
The Page Properties macro should be within the Expand one.

h3. Actual Results
The Page Properties macro gets under the Expand macro and not inside it instead.

h3. Workaround
If the customer is already migrated to the new editor, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Cannot add Page Properties macro inside the Expand macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
On "Page Tree Search" Macro you have to type the root page's name, and no visual indication is provided other than just a simple dialogue box. This may impact this macro usage, as users are not sure if they have the correct page selected, as no confirmation is given whatsoever when inserting the macro.

 !Screen Shot 2019-04-08 at 10.59.20.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide a more visual indication to users for which page is being selected, instead of relying on typing the page name alone,  such as being able to select the root page from a drop-down list of pages with clear hierarchical order of the pages;
h3. Why this is important

 !Screen Shot 2019-04-08 at 11.04.25.png|thumbnail! 
Suggestion: Users would be able to select the root page from a list similar to the image above
 
h3. Workaround 
* Copying the name of the desired page to be used as 'root' > Pasting on the "Page Tree Search" Macro; (Click on "Preview" to make sure that the page was correctly selected)
fields.summary: Improve Page Tree Search Macro usability

fields.description:
When you select a text in the editor and go to add the Panel macro, that text is automatically added in a panel. This is the same idea here, when we select a text and go to add the Expand macro, the text jumps to directly to the expand macro box.

This kind of action could be applied not only to a few features, but to every feature we can, once it provides a better editing experience from the user's perspective :)
fields.summary: Add Expand macro to selected text

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A Space can have one too many decisions under Meeting notes templates or normal pages, for example. 
There is no easy way to keep track of decisions created within the instance.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a Decision Report Macro, akin to the Task Report Macro.

h3. Why is this important
There is no easy or "correct" way of keeping track of all (or a select few) decisions in my instance.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Create a Decisions Report Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there's a custom field added to the Jira macro filter in Confluence, it will throw an error.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud
Jira filter macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Add a Jira filter macro
# Add the filter and under *Display options* add the custom field

h3. Expected Results
Jira issues should be rendered successfully. 

h3. Actual Results
Jira issues aren't properly rendering throwing the following error:

 !jira_filter.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Macro isn't rendering results if custom field is added in Display Options

fields.description:
As an end user, accessing Jira comment using a permanent link is more intuitive and UI friendly when compared to clicking on the date link of a comment on a Confluence page.

Also, there is no help text which would say that the date link is in fact the comment's permanent link. When I hover over the date link of a comment, the link text is the date value which does not serve any purpose. 

The best solution from user's perspective is to show the comment's permanent link as it would appear in Jira

Alternate solution: When the user hovers the date link, the link text should convey the message that the date link is in fact the comment's permanent link.

Hope I have a valid usability case here, so that we bring in some consistent and intuitive UI rendering across Jira and Confluence comments.

Thanks,

Ravi Varma
fields.summary: Confluence comment permanent link should be similar to JIRA comment permanent link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a blog post macro is created, the "Maximum Number of Blog Posts" is by default set to 100. This number is confusing as it only takes 15 as effective. If any number other than 100 is displayed it works fine.
h3. Environment


 * Confluence Cloud
 *
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create more than 15 blog posts in your site
 # Create a blog post macro
 # The "Maximum Number of Blog Posts" field by default has 100.
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

All the blog posts (maximum 100) should be displayed
h3. Actual Results

Only 15 blog posts are displayed
h3. Workaround

Change the number from 100 to any other number and it will display as expected.
fields.summary: Blog post Macro does not obey "Maximum Number of Blog Posts" as 100

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On the new Create Page Drawer (sidebar), it's not possible to create a page from a template if this template contains variables.

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud with the new create page drawer (integrated with the sidebar).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a template with a variable
# Go to Confluence home and try to create a page from that template

h3. Expected Results
The editor should load and show the template contents to create a new page. In this case, it was supposed to show the form with variables to be filled. 

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens, the drawer just closes without any error in the console. 

h3. Workaround
# Create a normal page;
# Insert the "Create from Template" selecting the desired template;
# Save the page;

You'll be able to use this button to create that specific template.
fields.summary: Can't create page from template with variables on the New Drawer

fields.description:
h2. Problem summary
The Restrict Page dialog can be mislead an administrator into thinking he/she has view/edit privileges when the admin is in fact restricted from doing so. This leads to confusion such as thinking that the "Edit" button is erroneously missing from a page.

h2. Scenario
Imagine a scenario where an admin has permissions to modify page restrictions, and goes to view a page which contains a page restriction. The admin is not currently page of list of privileged users that are allowed to edit the page, and notices that the "Edit" button is (correctly) missing. The admin then clicks the Padlock on a given page, and confusingly sees that his/her username is *already listed* among the other privileged users.

The admin thus believes a bug has been encountered (since the "Edit" button is missing) when really it's an issue with the Restrict Page dialog design. Consider the following two examples:

h2. Example 1 - When there are no page restrictions initially
* Create a page without any restrictions
* Log in as a user who can modify restrictions, and click the Padlock icon
* Change the dropdown to "Viewing and Editing restricted". Observe that your username is automatically shown in the dialog below

In this example, it is easy for the user to understand that while the username is shown with "Can view and edit", the changes are not committed until the Apply button is pressed. In other words, the dialog is showing you *what the restrictions config will update to if the Apply button is pressed*, rather than what is currently set for the page (which is nothing).

|Unrestricted page|What admin sees when clicking padlock and selecting
"Viewing and Editing restricted" in the dropdown|
|!unrestrictedpage.png|thumbnail!|!norestrictions.png|thumbnail!|

h2. Example 2 - When there are already restrictions on the page
* Create a page and restrict editing to yourself (but allow everyone to view)
* Log in as a different user who can modify restrictions, navigate to the page and hit the Padlock button

In this example, there are already existing restrictions on the page. The Restrictions dialog shows everyone that is part of the existing restrictions, however (just like in Example 1) it _also_ shows the current who is not currently part of it. The dialog is once again showing what the restrictions config for the page will look like *if the Apply button is pressed.*

|Page with existing restrictions|What admin sees when clicking padlock|
|!restrictedpage.png|thumbnail!|!existingrestrictions.png|thumbnail!|

This is a display problem is because the user, at this moment, is not actually part of the restrictions configs, and cannot edit the page. If the user presses Apply, that *will* in fact update the restrictions configs such that the user can edit the page afterwards. *The confusing part here is that there's nothing in the UI which clearly indicates what are the current settings, and what are the new changes that will occur if the button is pressed.*

In the case of Example 2, we can avoid this confusion by simply not auto-listing the current user viewing the Restrictions dialog, except when the user is factually part of the page restriction configs.
fields.summary: Confusing Restrict Page UI leads users to think their Edit button is wrongly missing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The option to enable "Secure administrator sessions" is still listed on Confluence Cloud, even though it's not possible to enable it, since this feature is only available for Confluence Server.

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove the option from /wiki/admin/viewsecurityconfig.action
fields.summary: Secure administrator sessions option is still listed on Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user adds a User Profile Macro inside a table cell, a blank line is added just above the macro and there is no way to remove it

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Add a table
 # Add a User Profile Macro inside one of the cells

h3. Expected Results
The macro is added and the is no extra spacing before or after it

h3. Actual Results
A blank line is added just above the macro


h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Adding a User Profile Macro inside a table cell adds a blank line above the macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Saved for later* screen is showing an unexpected error when it is opened.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on your photo at the left-bottom side and select the *Saved for later* option;
 # It will come with an error in the top of the screen: 
 !image-2019-04-03-15-50-31-076.png|width=570,height=169!

h3. Expected Results

The *saved for later* screen is loaded without this error message.
h3. Actual Results

It comes with the error:

_Error rendering WebPanel (com.atlassian.id.atlassian-account-plugin:shared-resources/panel.profileInitializationScript): Unable to compile Soy templates at: com.atlassian.id.atlassian-account-plugin:shared-resources_

h3. Notes
This error was also noticed on the personal settings page

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Saved for later" screen shows an error message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the user has edited the *Meeting Notes* template on the *Global templates and blueprints*, the *Meeting notes* template of the space will not be able to be edited.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As an administrator, go to *Settings > Global Templates and blueprints*
# Make sure to *edit* the Meeting Notes template and *publish* the configuration
# Go to any space and tap the *Space Settings > Content Tools > Templates* in order to edit the Meeting Notes template.
# Try to edit the Meeting Notes template.

h3. Expected Results
The template should be modified, or, face the same symptoms from [this related bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65348].

h3. Actual Results
Only a blank page is displayed (with a spinning icon) and no results are found from the console.

h3.Workaround
No workaround found at the moment
fields.summary: Modifying the global Meeting Notes will affect on the space template editing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The personal menu does not display correctly when the user navigates from one space to another space first time.
h3. Environment

*Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a new space in Confluence Cloud 
 # Click on the profile picture on the left bottom

h3. Expected Results

The entire menu should be displayed at once 
h3. Actual Results

Only half of the menu is displayed. (attached image)

 
h3. Workaround

Need to scroll to see the full menu or click on the profile picture again.
fields.summary: Clicking on the profile picture in Confluence doesnot show the full menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a new Meeting Notes page is created, it doesn't bring up the current date.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Click on *+* to create a new page
# Select *Meeting Notes* 

h3. Current behavior
The page brings up the wrong date.

 !meetingnotes.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected behavior
The page should bring up the date corresponding to the timezone set up in the profile.

h3. Workaround
No workaround available at this moment.
fields.summary: Wrong default date on Meeting Notes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sometimes, for some kind of Word files, the file viewer will keep loading the current page forever.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and insert a Word file;
 # Insert a Word macro
 # Publish and reload the page.

h3. Expected Results

The file should render normally;
h3. Actual Results

After scrolling, an infinite spinner is shown on the file and the current document's page is shown blank. It may need to reload the page a couple of times to notice the issue.
h3. Notes
 * Thousands of the following +information+ are shown on the console (select to show info or any logs):
{code:java}
mediaviewer-2.js:1531 Deprecated API usage: page destroy method, use cleanup() instead{code}

h3. Workaround

Reloading the page will sometimes render the file correctly.
fields.summary: Word macro viewer keeps loading the file intermittently

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The CPU consumption gets increased when the user clicks and start selecting cells in a table on a page.
h3. Environment

* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a page, create a 4x4 table;
# Click on a cell and move the mouse selecting the other cells;
# Check the CPU consumption while performing the above action.

h3. Expected Results
The CPU consumption shouldn't barely increase with this basic action.

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes the CPU consumption reaches 100% with this action

h3. Notes
This behavior was experienced in a Windows environment while using the Google Chrome browser. You can check more details in this ticket: *[JST-460814|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-460814 ]*

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround for that since this situation is intermittent
fields.summary: CPU Consumption gets high while selecting cells in a table
Export Space to PDF with image/text on the header does not work properly
Hide "created by" and "last updated by"
Undefined links should link pages other than title alone, when creating a new page from it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a Page Properties ID that starts with a 0 under the *Options* in Page Properties Report, the macro preview fetches the correct data. 
However, when publishing the page, it results in *No Content Found*

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Page Properties with an ID that starts with zero (0)
 # Publish the page
 # Create another page
 # Add a Page Properties Report
 # Specify the Page Properties ID created earlier
 # Preview the Macro (this should show the correct content)
 # Publish Page

h3. Expected Results
- The correct content is displayed in the published page

h3. Actual Results
- It just displays No Content Found, even though the preview works as expected

h3. Workaround
- Start the ID with another number from 1 to 9.
fields.summary: Adding Page Properties ID that starts with 0 to a Page Properties Report renders No Content Found

fields.description:

Pages created with new editor experience are not editable on iOS mobile app. It shows an error message *Unable to edit on mobile. This page uses the new editing experience*
h3. Environment

Confluenec cloud app - iOS
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with the new editor experience
 # Try to edit the above page

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to edit the pages in the app
h3. Actual Results

Users cannot edit the pages created with the new editor experience
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior on the iOS application directly but you can always access your Confluence application on the Safari browser to edit the pages.
fields.summary: Unable to edit pages with new editor layout on iOS mobile app

h3. Summary

Confluence returns "Page Not Found" if a user tries to create a template with the new editing experience.

h3. Environment

* Confluence Cloud tenants where [the new editing experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html#ConfluenceEditingImprovements-Newtemplates!(Andupdatestoexistingtemplates)] is roled out


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click *Add global page template* or *Create New Template*

 !Screenshot 2019-04-02 17.18.27.png|thumbnail!  !Screenshot 2019-04-02 17.17.50.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screenshot 2019-04-02 17.20.32.png|thumbnail!  !Screenshot 2019-04-02 17.20.39.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The user can successfully see a template creation page.

h3. Actual Results

Confluence returns 404 page.

h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support to ask disabling the new editor experience. 
Also consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Template is unavailable with the new editing experience

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing a page using the new editor, if we paste a link that is part of the site, it will appear shortened automatically. However, when you publish the page, it becomes a full link instead of what was displayed on paste.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create page 
# add a link to another page (link gets shortened to page name)
# Now publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The shortened link remains shortened

h3. Actual Results
The shortened link gets replaced with the original link

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Short links not working on new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The new fabric editor shows the table header text as bold when typing but when the page is published the header rows are not actually bold.

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page in new editor
# Insert a table
# Type in the header rows
# Type in the body
# Publish

h3. Expected Results
The header row should maintain the bold format showed while in edit mode

h3. Actual Results
The bold formatting is not applied

h3. Workaround
Apply bold format from the editor menu to the header

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The inline rich-text macro works perfectly in the old editor but not in the new one it moves to a new line.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a static macro with output type inline and with rich-text body type
# Create a new blog (with new text editor)
# Type a line "I want a cite here inline and not at the end of the line."
# Move the cursor to "inline" and insert the inline macro

h3. Expected Results
The macro should be inserted behind "inline" and also render inline.

h3. Actual Results
The macro is inserted at the end of the line and does not render inline.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user tries to print (Control/Command +P) a Confluence page, along with the page content page tree structure is also included.

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a page in Confluence
# Print (Command+P) the page
# In preview and the actual print, page tree/Confluence sidebar is included
# Same on Chrome, Firefox and Safari
  
h3. Expected Results
Only the page content should be included when a user prints the page

h3. Actual Results
Along with page content, other content of the screen is also printed.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cannot Add "Pie Chart" Macro to a page using the new editor
h3. Environment
 * New Editor
 * "Pie Chart" Macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add "Pie Chart" to a page - either by typing '/pie chart' or by clicking the *+* drop-down menu > "View More" > 'Pie Chart'

h3. Expected Results
 * Macro to be correctly inserted into the page;

h3. Actual Results
 * Error displayed on browser's console, after inserting the macro (typing '/pie chart'):
No macro is added to the page and the following error is displayed
{noformat}
TypeError: "g.params is undefined"
{noformat}
!Screen Shot 2019-04-01 at 11.30.37.png|thumbnail!

 * If inserting macro via *+* drop-down menu > "View More" > 'Pie Chart'
The macro is inserted, with the error below being thrown. When editing the macro, the availabe editing options are not of those of the "Pie Chart" Macro, as can be seen in the next screenshot
{noformat}
Error: undefined missing confluence/api/navigator-context
{noformat}
!Screen Shot 2019-04-01 at 11.54.16.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Instead of using "Pie Chart" Macro, use *"Jira Charts" macro* instead, and select Pie chart on the left pane of this macro > Add the desired JQL and volia! :D
(The macro may not be displayed in preview mode, or even edit mode, but once the page is published the macro will take a few seconds to load and will be displayed correctly)
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-01 at 11.54.30.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot Add "Pie Chart" Macro to a page using the new editor

Confluence cloud - Fabric editor

# Add some random text in first and second columns
# Create another page (Test page 2) with a table having more than 3 columns with random text
# Navigate to Test page 1 and in the left column insert Include page macro selecting Test page 2 in the macro.

# Content included in Include page macro is not within the first column width and it overlaps the text in the second column

Include page macro content should be within the width of the column

h3. Actual Results
Include page macro content overlaps the content in the second column

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

In Confluence, when the user is editing a page, if the same hover the cursors over the buttons from the editor toolbar, a text/information will be displayed to clarify what is the function for the button. However, when editing a page, none of the buttons will display information while being covered.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the [new editor experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], when the user tries to use the editor shortcut ("/") in order to add Jira gadgets (e.g Jira Issue Calendar, Jira Roadmap, Issue Statistics and Issues in progress), nothing will be triggered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page using the new editor
# Publish the page and *edit* it.
# Try to insert the Jira Issue Calendar or Jira Roadmap macros using the "/" shortcut

h3. Expected Results
The macro(s) configuration window should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3.Workaround
Use the *insert > More* option in order to include the macros on the page.
fields.summary: Unable to add Jira gadgets through shortcut

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a new page with the [new editor experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], prior to publishing it (still a draft only), the user will not able to add Jira gadgets (e.g Jira Issue Calendar, Jira Roadmap, Issue Statistics and Issues in progress) due to different errors.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page using the new editor
# Make sure to not publish this page and keep it only as a draft
# Try to insert a Jira gadget (e.g Jira Issue Calendar, Jira Roadmap, Issue Statistics and Issues in progress) into the page
# Depending on how you try to add the macro, a different error is displayed. Explained on the scenarios below.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to have both macros added and configured.

h3. Actual Results

*Scenario 1* 
If the user tries to use a shortcut to the macro(s) ("/name of the macro"), the *Activity Stream* macro configuration will be triggered.

*Scenario 2* 
If the user tries to use the macros through the *insert* option, the macro(s) configuration preview will only display blank content. By inserting it to the page, only blank content will be displayed as well.
 
h3. Notes
* This does not happen with the Legacy Editor
* Example of affected macros: Version Report, Voted Issues, Wallboard Spacer Gadget, Watched Issues, Workload Pie Chart.

h3.Workaround
* Publish the page, and then, use the *insert* option to use the macro(s).
* OR Insert these affected macros by clicking the *+* drop-down menu > View More > Choose the desired macro.
fields.summary: Unable to add Jira gadgets in new pages

fields.description: It would be great if we could generate a report containing a list of all Confluence pages including restricted ones as well and its metadata.
fields.summary: Add the ability to export a list of all pages in the instance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
According to the [Move, copy, and hide pages article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/move-copy-and-hide-pages-724764858.html#Move,copy,andhidepages-Notesaboutpermissions], in order to move pages and reorder them from the sidebar, you must have the *edit* restriction available. When a user tries to move a page not respecting this restriction, Confluence only provides the following message, and, a message below mentioning that the page has been moved (without is not correct):

!error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and *restrict* the edit of the same for you (or have another user doing it, and removing you from the *edit* restriction)
# After that, have another user trying to move the page. It's expected to not have it working.
# Observe the message

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should mention that the user does not have permission to move the page, instead of sharing a generic message and ask the user to contact the support.

h3. Actual Results

A message stating that "Something went wrong" is displayed and another message saying that the page has been moved will be following the same.

h3. Notes

* By using the *inspect > console* feature from the browser development tools, the following message is shown, which is what should be displayed on the UI:
!restriction.png|thumbnail!
* When trying to do the move operation, the error message will be displayed, but, below the same, a message saying that the page has been moved will be displayed, which is not correct and cause confusion.
* After facing this issue, you will no longer be able to move the pages in the sidebar. Only if refreshing the page.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Moving restricted pages on the sidebar fails without proper advice

fields.description:

In Confluence, Create from template macro doesn't show the list of available templates in Template name drop-down field and it's empty.

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud

# Click on the template list and the list will be empty(Check the screenshot *Template name.png*)

h3. Expected Results
Template list should show the list of available templates.

h3. Actual Results
Template list is empty

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Notes:
This is happening only on Confluence instances which have new design/layout shown when + is clicked in Confluence sidebar (attached the screenshot of the new layout shown when + is clicked in Confluence: *new layout.png*)
fields.summary: Template list not populating in Create from template macro

fields.description:
In the old editor, templates/blueprints have an option to add instructive text and the option available is Instructional text. However, in the new editor, the option name has been changed to Placeholder text which translates to a different name/nonmeaningful name for Spanish users.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing the *Settings* of the profile and checking the *Disable autoformatting* option, if the user tries to use the mention feature, the same will not work. Instead, it will only display the "mention" character following a formatting change.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence, tap your profile picture and select *Settings*
 # Select the *Editor* option
# There, make sure to check the *Disable "autoformatting"* option.
# Try to use the mention on a page

h3. Expected Results
The mention should work, once the Auto formatting should not disable the same.

h3. Actual Results
The mention no longer populates a user list, but, still uses the original formatting for the mention, as it is properly working:

!mention1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Disabling "autoformatting" removes the mention in Legacy Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Code Block macro in the old Editor (Note this issue does not occur with the new Editor) will crash the entire page if it encounters unterminated single quotes in the content within the Code Blocks when Python is selected as the syntax language.

h3. Environment
- Old Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page on the old editor
# Insert a codeblock and set its syntax to Python
# Insert some code with unterminated single quotes
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The page would load and display the code-block

h3. Actual Results
The entire tab for the browser freezes, and you're not able to even close it.

h3. Workaround
Create a new page with the new editor, where the problem doesn't happen.
fields.summary: Unterminated single-quotes on Code Block Macro with Python syntax, breaks the entire page

fields.description:
Currently, all our Confluence page is consisting of javascript from Cloudfront. When loading a plain text page with the new editor. A lot of resources are rendered on the page inclusive of fabric js and frontend.js and even loading the breadcrumb would need to load the javascript. 

The performance of the new editor was more severe with tables that loaded on the page.CONFCLOUD-65329 was open due to the performance while editing a page with a large table. 18.2 MB resources are loaded on a page with some plain text in preview mode and this caused some latency on loading the page. 

It would be best if we could optimize the performance by reducing the js that loaded from Cloudfront.
fields.summary: Improve performance for Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Old Space Keys aren't fetched by the /confluence connect command

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud integrated with Slack

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable [Confluence Cloud integration with a Slack Channel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-cloud-for-slack-956709523.html]
# In Slack, link to a personal space that has the {{~name.surname}} pattern in its URL, using the {{connect}} command as below:
{code}
/confluence connect instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~name.surname
{code}

h3. Expected Results
A Space preview would load in Slack's chat

h3. Actual Results
Slack fails to retrieve this information and fails with the warning below:
{quote}
That link doesn't match anything I can find on Confluence Cloud. Try copying the link again.
{quote}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Old Space Keys aren't fetched by the /confluence connect command

Table width in the pdf is the same as published page.

Table resizing does not happen (Attached image)

No Workaround
fields.summary: Column resize does not obey for export pdf

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The users cannot edit pages in space if they don't have add page permission in a space.

h3. Suggested Solution
Users should be able to edit a page if they have edit permission on the page but don't have add page permission in the space.

h3. Why this is important
The customer doesn't want users to add pages in the pages but he wants them to be able to edit without giving them add page permissions on space level.
As per this [article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/space-permissions-overview-724764760.html], the user should have add page permission in order to be able to have edit permissions on a page.
 
h3. Workaround 
NA
fields.summary: Add page permission should not be required for being able to edit pages

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the only way to change indexing language is to contact Atlassian Support.

!Screenshot 2019-01-28 16.28.49.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Make it able to configure indexing language for Confluence admins.
 Set a quota (like once per hour) for the change to avoid excessive workload from reindexing, similar to the one site backup has, if necessary.
h3. Workaround

Reach out to Atlassian Support [https://support.atlassian.com/contact/]. Also consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Ability to configure indexing language for admins
"Jira Issue/Filter" does not update custom field name and removes the custom field from "Columns to display".

fields.description:

When copying content from a page that has formatting done to the text, the editor has different behavior than if the content has been created by Confluence.

Confluence cloud

fields.description:

When in the new editor, adding a mention for a user who has never been in the product or site results in the page being unable to be published.

{noformat}
message: "com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.ServiceException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: User not found with account id: 0"
{noformat}

none

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Recent Spaces dropdown menu at the top of the sidebar is buggy in certain settings. This results in the menu either showing with half width of normal or not displaying at all.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

Steps to reproduce
# Open Recent Spaces menu and observe it displays correctly
# Collapse sidebar and then expand sidebar again
# Open Recent Spaces and it will now display the menu with half-width
# Select any other space than the one you are in
# Open Recent Spaces menu again

h3. Expected result
The Recent Spaces list should always display correctly with the correct width

h3. Actual result
In step 3 above it displays with half-width, and after step 5 above it will not display at all.

h3. Workaround
After step 5 above simply navigate to any page on that space and open Recent Spaces menu again.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using "JIRA Issue/Filter" macro users get an error when running a valid JQL query. Running the same JQL query on Jira correctly returns issues, but when trying to use this exact same query on "JIRA Issue/Filter" macro, the search do not return any results and throws the following error:
{quote}The JIRA server didn't understand your search query. If you entered JQL, please ensure that it's correctly formed. If you entered an issue key, ensure that it exists and you have permission to view it. Learn More
{quote}
!Screen Shot 2019-03-22 at 16.00.09.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment
 * Using "JIRA Issue/Filter" macro, when adding a query containing either "*WAS*" (e.g. "Status WAS "In Progress"") or "*CHANGED TO*" (e.g. "Status Changed TO "In Progress"").
 * It seems that *currentuser()* is affected by this BUG on "Assignee was currentuser()" and "Assignee changed TO currentuser()"
 * On Jira these JQL queries run like a charm, but running these queries on "JIRA Issue/Filter" macro breaks the macro and the error message above is displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert "JIRA Issue/Filter" macro into a page;
 # Run a JQL query on Jira containing one of these terms, for example " Status WAS "In Progress" ";
 # Run the same query on "JIRA Issue/Filter" macro.

h3. Expected Results
 * Query should run as expected and results should be displayed exactly like Jira's results

h3. Actual Results
 * No issue is returned and an error is displayed:
{quote}The JIRA server didn't understand your search query. If you entered JQL, please ensure that it's correctly formed. If you entered an issue key, ensure that it exists and you have permission to view it. Learn More
{quote}

h3. Notes

This behavior seems related to CONFCLOUD-65276 and CONFSERVER-57861
h3. Workaround
{panel}
There are currently thee workarounds for this BUG.
h4. 1st workaround:

Changing "WAS" to "WAS IN" seems to solve this issue - e.g. "Status WAS IN ("In Progress")";
h4. 2nd workaround (recommended):

Adding another TRUE statement to the JQL query seems to solve this issue (any true statement that won't change the result of the query search will do). For example changing "Status WAS "In Progress"" to "Status WAS "In Progress" and project != empty" correctly returned the desired results.
h4. 3rd workaround:

Saving this JQL search as a new filter in Jira, and instead of using "*JIRA Issue/Filter*" to search for issues, use instead "*Filter Results*" Macro > select the newly created filter.
{panel}
fields.summary: "JIRA Issue/Filter" macro search breaks when using a valid JQL query

h3. Summary

Customers are reporting issues while trying to access specific pages of Confluence Cloud. When trying to access it, the following message is displayed:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When inviting other users to collaborate in a page draft the dialog box closes when you try to select an user using the mouse, though it works using the keyboard.

Also if you add an user using the keyboard and hit the *Invite* button, the invitation green box shows up but no User is specified:
_Invite sent to _

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page draft;
# Hit the *+* sign to invite users to collaborate;
# Type the user name and try to select it using the mouse.


h3. Expected Results
The user is selected and you're able to send the invite.

h3. Actual Results
The dialog box closes just after you select the user.

h3. Workaround
# Create a page draft;
# Hit the *+* sign to invite users to collaborate;
# Type the user name and hit *enter* to add the user (*do not user the mouse click*)
# Hit the *tab* key twice so you select the *Invite* button;
# Hit *enter* once more so the invite is sent to the selected users;

If you select the user using the keyboard but hits the *Invite* button using the mouse click, the invite is sent empty and no users are notified/invited.
fields.summary: Invite to edit dialog box closes unexpectedly when selecting a user/inviting when using the mouse

h3. Summary
If the user adds an attachment/file on the page and then at a later stage decides to edit that attachment/file in Atlassian Companion, the updated file will no longer be clickable/selectable on the page. The file card will now just be an empty grey box.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud with Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Add a PowerPoint file to the page
# Publish page
# Preview PowerPoint file in browser
# Edit PowerPoint file through Atlassian Companion
# Attempt to preview file again

h3. Expected result
* The file card is still clickable/selectable and the user can view the attachment/file.

Actual result
* The file card is now just an empty grey box and selecting/clicking it has no effect.

Workaround
* The user can still access the file by selecting the page context menu \(...\), selecting Attachment List and then selecting View on the file in question.

h3. Issue Summary
'User Profile' macro does not display user's profile picture after a page is published, only the user's name and email are displayed.

 * Previewing the page, instead of publishing it, this macro display user's profile pictures as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add 'User Profile' macro to a page;

 !Screen Shot 2019-03-21 at 11.40.17.png|thumbnail! 
Result

If you do any changes to the question's title or topics (which are the only fields available, since description gets disabled) those are not saved.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With the [editing improvements for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], pages are center-aligned, in line with the default's section of the editor. In the Legacy Editor, the titles are left-aligned and this has been recently changed to make the title be center-aligned as well, which no longer matches with the default editor's section/editor's body.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

In Confluence, having the new editor already enabled for new pages, make sure to access a page using the Legacy Editor.

h3. Expected Results
The title should be left-aligned, in line with the text and the editor's body.

h3. Actual Results

The title is center-aligned as the model for the new editor experience.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Titles are center aligned for pages using the Legacy Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to delete a Confluence space, it hangs with the following error in browser console:
{code}Unhandled promise rejection Error: "GraphQL error: Not permitted to view space with key:<key>{code}

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any space, click on Space Settings.
# Click on Delete Space and then OK.

h3. Expected Results
Space should get deleted.

h3. Actual Results
The below error is thrown in the server logs:
{code}
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: update or delete on table "content" violates foreign key constraint "fklmhsipswol8imeqsg906ih62x" on table "confancestors"
 Detail: Key (contentid)=(4718595) is still referenced from table "confancestors".
{code}

In browser console:
{code}
Unhandled promise rejection Error: "GraphQL error: Not permitted to view space with key: <key>
{code}

h3. Notes
The space removal task remains as ENQUEUED in the long-running-tasks table.

h3. Workaround
Contact Atlassian Support to run the SQL queries on the following page to delete all traces of the space key:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/after-a-failed-space-import-it-s-not-possible-to-re-import-because-of-leftover-space-data-217743668.html
fields.summary: Deleting Confluence space hangs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Deleting multiple table rows in one operation often results in error message

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page in Fabric Editor
# Add a table
# Add a few extra rows to the table
# Delete multiple rows in one operation

h3. Expected result
The selected rows are removed without any problems

h3. Actual result
Often (but not always) a lengthy error message is displayed instead of the selected rows being removed. 
{code}
Something's gone wrong.
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.

Error details:
Error: Invalid position 109.
 in ie
 in t
 in div
 in styled.div
 in t
 in div
 in div
 in ContentArea
 in div
 in ClickWrapper
 in t
 in div
 in styled.div
 in ScrollContainer
 in div
 in FullPageEditorWrapper
{code}

Once the user clicks Refresh at the end of the error message the page reloads and all the rows are still there.

h3. Workaround
Remove one row at a time.
fields.summary: Deleting multiple table rows in one operation often results in error message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the old editor, when text is entered in the center column (only single line text) it moves to the left column once the page is published. This happens on the "three columns with side-bars" option of the page layout. This does not happen on a newly created page layout and occurs on existing page layouts when the text is one single line.

h3. Environment
 * Old Editor
 * Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit page containing the page layout with "three columns with side-bars" option.
# Type single line text in the center column and leave the left column empty.
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
Text should remain in the center after publishing.

h3. Actual Results
The text moves to the left column after publishing.
(This does not happen when the new page layout is created)

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
Enter more than a single line of text.
fields.summary: Single line text moves from centre to left column in existing three columns with side-bars (Page Layout)

The page titles do not wrap at all and will overwrite content in the column to the left.
